Class VocabBackOffice

java.lang.Object
  VocabBackOffice

public class VocabBackOffice
extends Object

This is supposed to combine WordDatabase2 and LatinVocabHelper.

Version:
1 04
Author:
Richard Gu

Constructor Detail

VocabBackOffice

public VocabBackOffice(String newFileName)
Creates a VocabBackOffice :)

Parameters:

Method Detail

addWordToFile

public void addWordToFile(String word,
                          String fileName,
                          boolean type)
This adds a specified word and definition to the specified file.

Parameters:
word - the word you're adding
fileName - the name of the file you're adding to
type - whether the word you're adding is a definition (false) or the required input (true)

addWordToMissed

public void addWordToMissed(String word,
                            String clue)
Adds a missed word to the missedWordsList arraylist. Precondition: the word and clue correspond correctly

Parameters:
word - the word you're adding
clue - the clue you're adding

clearMissed

public void clearMissed()
Clears the missed arraylists. This is only useful if you want to clear it (no duh) EX: I'm done with a file (this means you auto-save a missed words list for it). So, I would want to clear the arraylists so I can have file-specific missed txts.

createNewFile

public void createNewFile(String fileName)
If the user wants to create a new file within the program, then use this method. Another method will be used to add stuff to the selected file.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file that you want to create

getCluesList

public ArrayList<String> getCluesList()
Gets the clues list. Note that if using the missed words lists for testing, this will return those missed clues, not the ones that you missed while testing the missed words (awk wording...)

Returns:
an ArrayList of all the clues

getFile

public String getFile()
Gets the current file name.

Returns:
the name of the current file

getFileLength

public int getFileLength()
                  throws IOException
Gets the file length of the current chapter file.

getMissedCluesList

public ArrayList<String> getMissedCluesList()
Gets the missed clues list. Note that if the missed words/clues are the active lists, then it won't return the current missed clues; instead, it will return the missed clues from that testing.

Returns:
an array of all the corresponding clues to the missed words

getMissedWordsList

public ArrayList<String> getMissedWordsList()
Gets the missed words list. Note that if the missed words/clues are the active lists, then it won't return the current missed words; instead, it will return the missed words from that testing.

Returns:
an array of all the missed words

getWordsAndClues

public void getWordsAndClues()
                      throws IOException
Sets up the word and clue arrays.

getWordsList

public ArrayList<String> getWordsList()
Gets the words list. Note that if using the missed words lists for testing, this will return those missed words, not the ones that you missed while testing the missed words (awk wording...)

Returns:
an ArrayList of all the words

isCorrect

public boolean isCorrect(String guess)
Checks if the user guessed the word correctly.

Returns:
true if the user did; otherwise false.

pickWordAndClue

public String[] pickWordAndClue()
Randomly selects a word and the corresponding clue from the String[]s.

Returns:
a String[] of length 2 holding the word and clue that was picked

removeWordAndClue

public void removeWordAndClue(String word,
                              String clue)
Removes the word and clue from the arraylists. Precondition: the word and clue correspond correctly

Parameters:
word - the word you're removing
clue - the clue you're removing

sendMissedToFile

public void sendMissedToFile(String fileName)
Creates a new file for the missed words.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file you're creating

setStage

public void setStage(String newFile)
Sets the file to a new one and updates the word list and clue list.

Parameters:
newFile - the name of the new file

trimDownWordsAndClues

public void trimDownWordsAndClues()
                           throws NullPointerException
Gets rid of words that were already used. This is to make sure that every word will be tested and also so that words don't randomly repeat.

Throws:
NullPointerException - if the words or clues are null

useMissedLists

public void useMissedLists()
A method to allow the user to test the missed words.
